labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides access to the Metropolitan Museum of Art's vast collection through natural language queries and specialized tools. Its core functionality revolves around searching for and retrieving detailed information about artworks, departments, and collections. The available tools enable users to list all departments, search for specific objects (with optional filters like title or image availability), and fetch detailed information about individual objects by their IDs. This server solves problems related to art research, cultural exploration, and accessing curated, detailed art metadata.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's main purpose is to enable queries and searches within the Met Museum's collection, making it a research-oriented tool. The secondary label "Education" is added because the server allows users to explore and learn about artworks, departments, and cultural artifacts, which aligns with educational use cases. No custom label is necessary as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: list-departments
tools.description: List all departments in the Metropolitan Museum of Art (Met Museum)

tools.name: search-museum-objects
tools.description: Search for objects in the Metropolitan Museum of Art (Met Museum). Will return Total objects found, followed by a list of Object Ids.The parameter title should be set to true if you want to search for objects by title.The parameter hasImages is false by default, but can be set to true to return objects without images.If the parameter hasImages is true, the parameter title should be false.

q.description: The search query, Returns a listing of all Object IDs for objects that contain the search query within the object's data

hasImages.description: Only returns objects that have images

title.description: This should be set to true if you want to search for objects by title

departmentId.description: Returns objects that are in the specified department. The departmentId should come from the 'list-departments' tool.

tools.name: get-museum-object
tools.description: Get a museum object by its ID, from the Metropolitan Museum of Art Collection

objectId.description: The ID of the museum object to retrieve

returnImage.description: Whether to return the image (if available) of the object and add it to the server resources

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mikechao/metmuseum-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
